p: Clinically, patients were diagnosed as mild (76 cases, 83.5%) or severe (15 cases, 16.5%) cases. The fifteen severe patients included three local and 12 imported cases. Among these severe patients, 14 had complicated bacterial infections, nine had septic shock, 13 had ARDS, six had multiple organ dysfunction syndrome (MODS), and three patients died. Compared with local patients, imported patients had a higher prevalence of fever ( P = 0.001), a higher peak temperature ( P = 0.028), and more complicated infections ( P = 0.043) and tended to be more severe (21.4% vs 8.6%) (Table 2).
